titleStmt.title: The Letters of Robert Bloomfield and His Circle
A Romantic Circles Electronic Edition

publicationStmt.publisher: Romantic Circles, http://www.rc.umd.edu, University of Maryland

availability.p: Material from the Romantic Circles Website may not be downloaded, reproduced or disseminated in any manner without authorization unless it is for purposes of criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, and/or classroom use as provided by the Copyright Act of 1976, as amended.

Unless otherwise noted, all Pages and Resources mounted on Romantic Circles are copyrighted by the author/editor and may be shared only in accordance with the Fair Use provisions of U.S. copyright law. Except as expressly permitted by this statement, redistribution or republication in any medium requires express prior written consent from the author/editors and advance notification of Romantic Circles. Any requests for authorization should be forwarded to Romantic Circles:> Romantic Circles c/o Professor Neil Fraistat Department of English University of Maryland College Park, MD 20742 fraistat@umd.edu

By their use of these texts and images, users agree to the following conditions:
These texts and images may not be used for any commercial purpose without prior written permission from Romantic Circles.
These texts and images may not be re-distributed in any forms other than their current ones.

Users are not permitted to download these texts and images in order to mount them on their own servers. It is not in our interest or that of our users to have uncontrolled subsets of our holdings available elsewhere on the Internet. We make corrections and additions to our edited resources on a continual basis, and we want the most current text to be the only one generally available to all Internet users. Institutions can, of course, make a link to the copies at Romantic Circles, subject to our conditions of use.

monogr.title: The Letters of Robert Bloomfield and His Circle
A Romantic Circles Electronic Edition

quotation.p: All quotation marks and apostrophes have been changed: " for “," for ”, ' for ‘, and ' for ’.

hyphenation.p: Any dashes occurring in line breaks have been removed.
Because of web browser variability, all hyphens have been typed on the U.S. keyboard

normalization.p: Bloomfield's spelling has not been regularized.
Writing in other hands appearing on these manuscripts has been indicated as such, the content recorded in brackets.
& has been used for the ampersand sign.
£ has been used for £, the pound sign
All other characters, those with accents, non-breaking spaces, etc., have been encoded in HTML entity decimals.

taxonomy.bibl: NINES categories for Genre and Material Form at http://www.performantsoftware.com/nines_wiki/index.php/Submitting_RDF#.3Cnines:genre.3E on 2009-02-26

list.item: create image wrappers; run edition for last time through xslt.

Proofing, re-coding letters, and TEI encoding of preliminary materials
TEI Encoding, first pass, all letters

Portrait engraving by William Ridley after a design by Samuel Drummond , published in the Monthly Mirror (1800).
Frontispiece to 2nd and subsequent editions of The Farmer's Boy (London: Vernor and Hood, 1800). Woodcut by Charlton Nesbit from a design by John Thurston .
Portrait engraving by William Ridley after a design by Samuel Drummond , published in the European Magazine (1801).
Copperplate engraving by R. Rhodes , after a drawing by Thomson . Illustration to The Farmer's Boy (separately issued: London: Vernor and Hood, 1802), 'Spring'.
Copperplate engraving to The Farmer's Boy (separately issued: London: Vernor and Hood, 1802), 'Summer'.
Copperplate engraving to The Farmer's Boy (separately issued: London: Vernor and Hood, 1802), 'Autumn'.
Portrait engraving by William Ridley after a painting by Henry Edridge , from Rural Tales, Ballads and Songs (London: Vernor and Hood, 1802).
Engraving used to accompany the poem 'Rosy Hannah' in Rural Tales, Ballads and Songs (London: Vernor and Hood, 1802).

Frontispiece to Nathaniel Bloomfield's Essay on War, in Blank Verse; Honington Green, a Ballad … and Other Poems (London: Hurst, Vernor and Hood, 1803), engraved by Cook after a sketch by E. V. Blomfield .
Frontispiece to 8th edn of The Farmer's Boy (London: Vernor and Hood, 1805), engraved by Robert Branston after a design by William Marshall Craig .
Woodcut illustration to the 8th edn of The Farmer's Boy (London: Vernor and Hood, 1805), headpiece.
Woodcut illustration to the 8th edn of The Farmer's Boy (London: Vernor and Hood, 1805), headpiece to 'Spring', after a design by William Marshall Craig .
Woodcut illustration to the 8th edn of The Farmer's Boy (London: Vernor and Hood, 1805), 'Autumn', the distracted woman.

Grieg , medallion portrait of Robert Bloomfield, from Views in Suffolk, Norfolk, and Northamptonshire, Illustrative of the Works of Robert Bloomfield; Accompanied with Descriptions: to which is Annexed a Memoir of the Poet's Life by E. W. Brayley (London: Vernor, Hood and Sharpe, 1806).

Marble Bust, engraved by B. Holl (S. Robinson, 1808).
'New Wear on the Wye', from The Banks of Wye; a Poem in Four Books, 2nd edn. (London: printed for B. and R. Crosby & Co., 1813). Engraved by Hayes after a design by Robert Bransby Cooper .

'Martin's Tower, Chepstow Castle', from The Banks of Wye; a Poem in Four Books, 2nd edn. (London: printed for B. and R. Crosby & Co., 1813). Engraved by Hayes after a design by Robert Bransby Cooper .

'Van Mountain, near Brecknock, from the Priory Woods', from The Banks of Wye; a Poem in Four Books (London: printed for B. and R. Crosby & Co., 1813). Engraved by Hayes after a design by Robert Bransby Cooper.

'View of the Usk through a Gateway at Crickhowel' from The Banks of Wye; a Poem in Four Books, 2nd edn. (London: printed for B. and R. Crosby & Co., 1813). Engraved by Hayes after a design by Robert Bransby Cooper .
Robert Bloomfield , bookplate (London: printed for Robert Bloomfield by W. Jackson, printer, 1813).

'The Maen y Morwynion or Maiden Stone' from The Antiquarian and Topographical Cabinet; Containing a Series of Elegant Views of the Most Interesting Objects of Curiosity in Great Britain, vol. 4 (London: published for the Proprietor, by J. Murray, Nornaville and Fell, C. Chapple, Taylor and Hessey, J. M. Richardson, and Sherwood, Neely, and Jones, 1818). Engraved after a sketch by Robert Bloomfield .
Portrait engraved by T. Woolnoth after a design by T. C. Wageman , from the Ladies' Monthly Museum (1823).
'House in Pitcher's Court, Bell Alley, once the Residence of Robert Bloomfield' from The Gentleman's Magazine (December 1823), 496.

The Cottage wherein Bloomfield was Born, at Honington, in Suffolk, from The Table Book, of Daily Recreation and Information: Concerning Remarkable Men, Manners, Times, Seasons, Solemnities, Merry-Makings, Antiquities and Novelties, Forming a Complete History of the Year (London: William Tegg, 1827-28), p. 831.
Portrait engraving after a design by Solomon Polack , published by Vernor and Hood, 1800.
